alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 22 at 2:08PM CST until February 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CST FOR SOUTHWESTERN MONROE...WESTERN RANDOLPH...SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...STE. GENEVIEVE AND EASTERN ST. FRANCOIS COUNTIES... At 208 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Crystal City to Bloomsdale to near Junction City, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ste. Genevieve, Red Bud and Evansville. This also includes Hawn State Park and Felix Valle House State Park. This includes Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 141 and 162. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southwestern Illinois...and southeastern and east central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
